Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Needs \Needs\, adv. [Orig. gen. of need, used as an adverb. Cf. {-wards}.] Of necessity; necessarily; indispensably; -- often with must, and equivalent to of need. [1913 Webster]
A man must needs love mauger his head. --Chaucer. [1913 Webster]
And he must needs go through Samaria. --John iv. 4. [1913 Webster]
He would needs know the cause of his repulse. --Sir J. Davies. [1913 Webster]
needs adv : in such a manner as could not be otherwise; "it is necessarily so"; "we must needs by objective" [syn: {inevitably}, {necessarily}, {of necessity}]
